text: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
author: J.K. Rowling
book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling
book: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

text: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
author: Charles Dickens

text: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.
author: Charlotte Brontë

text: The creature waited for me; and when I appeared it approached me with gestures of delight.
author: Mary Shelley

text: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
author: Mary Shelley

text: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

text: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading!
author: Jane Austen

text: The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.
author: Mark Twain

text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I’m not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: A person's a person, no matter how small.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: J.K. Rowling
book: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

text: Fear is the mind-killer.
author: Frank Herbert

text: The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.
author: Frank Herbert

text: The spice must flow.
author: Frank Herbert

text: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: I hope she'll be a fool—that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: Call me Ishmael.
author: Herman Melville

text: From hell's heart I stab at thee; for hate's sake I spit my last breath at thee.
author: Herman Melville

text: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
author: Herman Melville

text: Time moves slowly, but passes quickly.
author: Alice Walker

text: Whenever you are creating beauty around you, you are restoring your own soul.
author: Alice Walker

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.
author: Alice Walker

text: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All that is gold does not glitter.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: We are all fools in love.
author: Jane Austen

text: There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well.
author: Jane Austen

text: Till this moment I never knew myself.
author: Jane Austen

text: The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive.
author: John Green

text: Some infinities are bigger than other infinities.
author: John Green

text: The marks humans leave are too often scars.
author: John Green

text: The question isn’t who is going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: We can evade reality, but we cannot evade the consequences of evading reality.
author: Ayn Rand

text: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Shoot all the bluejays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.
author: Harper Lee

text: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.
author: Harper Lee

text: People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for.
author: Harper Lee

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: George Eliot

text: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses we must plant more roses.
author: George Eliot

text: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou
book: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

text: Try to be a rainbow in someone’s cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

text: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
author: Stephen King

text: So many things are possible just as long as you don’t know they’re impossible.
author: Norton Juster

text: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
author: Gabriel García Márquez
book: Love in the Time of Cholera

text: No medicine cures what happiness cannot.
author: Gabriel García Márquez

text: What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it.
author: Gabriel García Márquez
